Detailed Description

Base implementation accessing hardware cameras

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef struct Camera::ParameterLimits Camera::ParameterLimits
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Camera::ActionType
 

defines the action which will be performed for changing the zoom

Enumerator:
Decrease  Decreases zoom level.
Reset  resets zoom level to default
Increase  increases zoom level

enum Camera::AntiFlickerType
 

Types for AntiFlicker

Enumerator:
AntiFlickerNotSupported  will be used as return value if no anti flicker is supported
AntiFlickerDisabled  Anti flicker reduction is disabled.
AntiFlickerHz50  Anti flicker is set to compensate 50Hz environment.
AntiFlickerHz60  Anit flicker is set to compensate 60Hz environment.

enum Camera::CameraError
 

Error codes in case of FALSE return type in camera methods or in case of CameraErrorMsg

Enumerator:
NoError 
CameraAlreadyLockedError  This error occurs, if another application is already using the CameraDevice.
CameraNotReadyError  Reports a driver problem.
UnsupportedCameraFeature  indicates, that the requested feature is not present for the camera
CameraNotInitializedError  Camera has not been initialzed properly.
BufferNotAvailableError  indicates, that one buffer from BufferPoolManager is not available (for MMFr)
BufferAllocationError  indicates, that not enough buffer are available for capturing
VideoEncoderBufferAllocationError  not enough memory for VideoEncoder is available
ApplicationControlError  Application made.
UnsupportedFrameRateError  Framerate is not supported for this Camera.
InvalidCameraParameter  Usually, this indicated, that application tried to set a value, which is out of range.
InvalidSizeError  Image size is not supported or not known.
JpegEncodingError  during JPEG encoding, an error occured
UserAbortedError  user aborted capturing process

enum Camera::CameraState
 

Enumerator:
UnitializedState 
IdleState 
ViewfindingState 
ViewfinderHiddenState 
ImageCapturingState 
VideoCapturingState 
VideoCapturingHiddenState 
ViewfinderHoldState 
ViewfinderHoldHiddenState 
VideoCapturingPausedState 
ErrorState 

enum Camera::FilterType
 

Filters between 50 and 100 are custom ones

Enumerator:
NoFilter 
SepiaFilter 
EmbossFilter 
GrayScaleFilter 
NegativeFilter 
HorrorFilter 
HazeFilter 
GlassTileFilter 
PuzzleTileFilter 
OilpaintFilter 
PictureFrameFilter 
FilmFilter 
ConcaveFilter 
EndOfFilterType 

enum Camera::FlashType
 

FlashType has several flash modes

Enumerator:
FlashNotSupported 
FlashDisabled  Flash or Flash LED will be set to off.
FlashEnabled  Flash LED will be set to on or in case of a real flash, next snapshot will be with flash.
AutomaticFlash  Camera decides wheter to use flash or not.
RedEyeReductionFlash  Enables red-eye-reduction flash.

enum Camera::ImageSizeType
 

ImageSize has given list of possible predefined image sizes

Enumerator:
QqcifSize  88x72
Size96x96  96x96
SqcifSize  128x96
QqvgaSize  160x120
QcifSize  176x144
QsifSize  276x120
QvgaSize  320x240
CifSize  352x288 - 0.3 Mp
VgaSize  640x480
SvgaSize  800x600
XgaSize  1024x768
Size1Mp  1152x864 - 1.0 Mp
Size1_3Mp  1280x960 - 1.3 Mp
SxgaSize  1280x1024
UxgaSize  1600x1200
Size2Mp  1728x1152
Size3Mp  2048x1536 - 3.0 Mp
EndOfImageSizeType 

enum Camera::MeteringType
 

Enumerator:
FullImageMetering  average luminance of whole image will be used for metering
CenterBasedMetering  center of image has more priority for metering than other parts

enum Camera::Result
 

Enumerator:
ViewfinderStarted 
ViewfinderStopped 
BrightnessChanged 
ContrastChanged 
ExposureChanged 
FilterChanged 
AntiflickerChanged 
TwilightChanged 
WhiteBalanceChanged 
FrameRateChanged 
VideoCaptureStarted 
VideoCaptureStopped 
VideoCapturePaused 
VideoCaptureUnPaused 

enum Camera::ScalingMethodType
 

Predefined scaling method for viewfinder

Enumerator:
NoScaling  Viewfinder will not be scaled but just cropped to given area.
LetterboxScaling  Viewfinder will be scaled using letterbox to given area.
BestFitScaling  Viewfinder will be scaled to fill out the given area best cropping could be done on top/bottom and left/right side

enum Camera::TransformationType
 

Transformation for viewfinder and/or captured image, which can be set in Camera::SetViewfinderRect and Camera::SetCaptureTransformation.

Enumerator:
NoTransformation  Default type. No transformation is done.
Rotate90  Will rotate the image orientation 90 degrees in a clockwise direction.
Rotate180  Will rotate the image orientation 180 degrees in a clockwise direction.
Rotate270  Will rotate the image orientation 270 degrees in a clockwise direction.
Mirror  Will mirror the image.
MirrorRotate90  Will first mirror the image and the rotate the image 90 degrees clockwise.
MirrorRotate180  Will first mirror the image and the rotate the image 180 degrees clockwise.
MirrorRotate270  Will first mirror the image and the rotate the image 270 degrees clockwise.

enum Camera::TwilightType
 

Twilight modes

Enumerator:
TwilightOff  No twilight enhancement.
TwilightOn  Twilight enhancement enabled.
TwilightAuto  Automatic setting for twilight.

enum Camera::WhiteBalanceType
 

Types for setting WhiteBalance

Enumerator:
AutoBalance  Camera sensor decides best WB.
SunlightBalance  WB for Sunlight surrounding.
CloudyBalance  WB for cloudy surrounding.
IncandescentBalance  WB for indoor surrounding.
FluorescentBalance  WB for fluorescent surrounding.

BOOLEAN Camera::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Close() frees any allocated buffers for capturing and unlocks the camera.

Returns:
returns FALSE if unlocking or buffer deallocation fails.

Reimplemented in StillCamera, StillCamera, VideoCamera, StillCamera, and StillCamera.

INT Camera::GetZoomLevelCount (   )  const [virtual]
 

Gets the number of zoom levels. The number of zoom levels depends on the choosen capture image size and the choosen capture transformation.

Returns:
returns The number of zoom levels supported by choosen capture image size and capture transformation.

BOOLEAN Camera::HideViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

HideViewfinder() allows an application to draw over the viewfinder. The camera will not refresh the viewfinder but remains active.

Returns:
returns FALSE if an hardware error occurred or this feature is not available.

BOOLEAN Camera::IsTwinViewfinderEnabled (   )  const
 

returns TRUE if twinviewfinder is currently enabled

BOOLEAN Camera::Open (   )  [virtual]
 

Open() sets default values for the Camera which are available through a CameraConfig or by driver. Furthermore it tries to Lock the Camera for exclusive usage.

Returns:
returns FALSE, if setting values or locking failed.

Reimplemented in StillCamera, VideoCamera, and StillCamera.

BOOLEAN Camera::RestartViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

BOOLEAN Camera::SetAntiFlickerMode (  AntiFlickerType  anti_flicker_mode  ) 
 

Enables or disables the anti flicker mode. The scanning frequency can be toggled between 50 and 60Hz. If the camera does not support an anti flicker mode, this does not have an effect and FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
anti_flicker_mode the requested anti flicker mode.
Returns:
TRUE if setting the anti flicker mode was successful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetBrightness (  INT  brightness  ) 
 

Sets the brightness for the viewfinder

Parameters:
brightness define the brightness value to be performed
Returns:
returns FALSE if brightness level was out of range.

)  [virtual]
 

Sets the capture image size for snapshots and video capturing.

capture_image_size predefined image size for captured image.
capture_transformation capture image transformation.
Returns:

BOOLEAN Camera::SetContrast (  INT  level  ) 
 

Sets the contrast for the viewfinder

Parameters:
level define the contrast value to be performed. Configration of contrast range is done via CameraConfig
Returns:
returns FALSE if contrast level was out of range

BOOLEAN Camera::SetExposure (  INT  level  ) 
 

This function is used to set the exposure value level of the camera sensor Exposure value is the relationship between aperture and shutter time. Changing the exposure value is done by changing the exposure time, as changing the aperture is not possible on mobile cameras. Thus, this controls how much light is allowed to hit the sensor

Parameters:
level level in between range given by GetExposureLimits()
Returns:
returns TRUE if exposure level was set successfully

BOOLEAN Camera::SetFilter (  FilterType  filter  ) 
 

SetFilter() applies an image effect on the viewfinder and on the captured image. This feature is highly hardware dependent and in case of no filter support FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
filter desired filter
Returns:
returns TRUE if applying filter was successful

BOOLEAN Camera::SetFlash (  FlashType  flash  ) 
 

Enables or disables the flash. If the camera does not have a flash, this does not have an effect and FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
flash desired flash type for the next snapshot
Returns:
TRUE if setting the flash was ok, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetMeteringMode (  MeteringType  metering_mode  ) 
 

Changes the metering mode of the camera. Usually, the average luminace will be used in the whole picture will be used for adjusting the exposure time. If there is a bright light source from the side, this can be compensated by giving center luminace a higher value than outer parts of the picture.

Parameters:
metering_mode desired metering for the camera sensor.
Returns:
returns TRUE if desired metering is available.

void Camera::SetState (  CameraState  state  )  [inline, protected]
 

BOOLEAN Camera::SetTwilightMode (  TwilightType  twilight  ) 
 

Enables or disables the twilight mode or sets it into automatic mode. This increases the sensitivity of the camera's imaging sensor. If the camera does not support a twilight mode, this does not have an effect and FALSE is returned. By default, camera operates in twilight off mode.

Parameters:
twilight sets desired twilight mode.
Returns:
TRUE if setting the twilight mode was successful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetTwinViewfinderEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  ) 
 

This method enables twin viewfinder support, which means, that the viewfinder will be displayed on BOTH displays at the same time. This feature is ONLY available, if feature define APOXI_CAMERA_TWINVIEWFINDER_SUPPORT is set. The sequence for using twinviewfinder is as follows:

Viewfinder on Main only:

Camera::SetViewfinderRect(main_rect, 0, NoTransformation); // setting up rect for main display Camera::StartViewfinder(); // starts viewfinder on main Camera::StopViewfinder(); // stops viewfinder on main

Viewfinder on sub only:

Camera::SetViewfinderRect(sub_rect, 1, Rotate180); // example for sub display rect, rotated Camera::StartViewfinder(); // starts viewfinder on sub Camera::StopViewfinder(); // stops viewfinder on sub

Viewfinder both in main and sub:

Camera::SetViewfinderRect(main_rect, 0, NoTransformation); // setup viewfinder for main Camera::SetViewfinderRect(sub_rect, 1, Rotate180); // setup viewfinder for sub Camera::SetTwinViewfinderEnabled(TRUE); // sets viewfinder to both main&sub Camera::StartViewfinder(); // starts both main and sub Camera::StopViewfinder(); // stops both main and sub

Parameters:
enabled enables twinviewfinder
Returns:
returns FALSE if twinviewfinder is not supported, or viewfinder configuration is invalid (missing rect for subdisplay)

BOOLEAN Camera::SetViewfinderRect (  Rect &  vf_rect,
INT  display_idx = 0,
TransformationType  view_transformation = NoTransformation,
ScalingMethodType  view_scaling_method = NoScaling
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the rectangle, display, orientation and scaling of the camera viewfinder.

Parameters:
vf_rect Rectangle which describes the viewfinder (in and out parameter)
display_idx Index of display where viewfinder should be drawn at, default is main display
view_transformation Desired orientation of the viewfinder, default is normal orientation.
view_scaling_method Desirted scaling method, default is no scaling.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if viewfinder size, position and orientation is valid.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetViewScalingMethod (  ScalingMethodType  scaling_method  )  [virtual]
 

SetViewScalingMethod() defines, which scaling method should be applied for the viewfinder. This function needs to be set before enabling the viewfinder but is optional.

Parameters:
scaling_method scaling method for viewfinder
Returns:
returns FALSE if desired scaling method is not applicable.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetWhiteBalance (  WhiteBalanceType  white_balance_mode  ) 
 

SetWhiteBalance sets the camera white balance mode.

Parameters:
white_balance_mode desired white balance mode type.
Returns:
returns TRUE when setting of white balance is successful. Otherwise FALSE is returned.

BOOLEAN Camera::SetZoom (  ActionType  action,
UINT8  step_size = 1
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the zoom factor for the viewfinder

Parameters:
action defines which zooming action should be performed. Decrease - decreases zoom level Increase - increases zoom level Reset - resets zoom level to default value
step_size Step changes the interval on the performed action
Returns:
returns FALSE if zoom is out of range or driver error.

BOOLEAN Camera::ShowViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

ShowViewfinder() again displays the viewfinder on the display. Display content will be overwritten by the camera again.

Returns:
returns FALSE if an hardware error occurred or this feature is not available.

BOOLEAN Camera::StartViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

StartViewfinder() enables the viewfinder on the display and sets the camera into active mode.

Returns:
returns FALSE if viewfinder can not be started due to missing preconditions or a hardware failure.

Reimplemented in VideoCamera.

BOOLEAN Camera::StopViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

StopViewFinder() stops the viewfinder and shuts down the camera.

Returns:
returns FALSE if an hardware error occurred.

Reimplemented in VideoCamera.
